Text:
Al and Sandra Solberg, formerly of Williston, say that life in Bismarck keeps them busy and fulfilled. They left and leased the farm northwest of Williston partly because of how the oil boom changed the rural countryside. Ardell and Charlene Horop, now of Bismarck and formerly of New Town, are part of a surprising number of people who are leaving the oil patch. They were longtime business people, and Ardell Horop says he still likes to visit New Town often. Earlier this year, Kevin Iverson, manager of the North Dakota Census Office, gave a presentation on population growth in North Dakota. David Hynek BISMARCK â€” Ardell Horob is a happy man, hanging out at jam sessions in the warm Arizona sunshine in the winter and with family at his new Bismarck home in the summer.
